sub_title: Financial Controller at Cemex (World Trade Center Amsterdam)
summary:
I’m Pablo Trevino, an expat Mexican 38 years old, working for a World Leading Multinational Company (CEMEX) for almost 15 years in different countries within Europe in a very multicultural environment starting in London, Madrid, Luxembourg and now based in Amsterdam. I have a lot of experience in handling financial information for all businesses within the Cemex Group. I’m responsible and part of the team who prepares the Monthly Results Presentation and Consolidated Reports to the Top Management for the EMEAA Region with the consolidated financial figures and explanations for the period (Actuals vs Pyear vs Budget/Forecast variations), extensive knowledge of all institutional tools of the company at accounting/consolidation level (SAP-Hyperion/HFM), great expertise in management financial reporting (KPI’s) of the company, compliance with local financial reporting to local Central Banks, liaising with auditors for Annual Accounts/Financial Statements preparation, involve in forecast and budget preparation for strategic entities and KPI's.

Highly analytical, reviewer of tons of data and financial data evaluation metrics in a montly basis during the "month end closing process" in an extremely demanding and time pressure environment.

As member of the Board of Directors of the Dutch Holdings Entities of the Group, I have experience, awareness and within my responsibilities to review and sign important documents/transactions related to Finance Agreements, Board Meeting Resolutions, sales/acquisitions within the Group, liaising with Corporate Legal/Tax related to contracts or specific transactions, also knowledge and experience working with Corporate Treasury Team related to our In-House Bank (Loans Portfolio) and other strategic entities such as the Reinsurance companies of the Group (Risk Management).

Likewise, serving all Region EMEAA countries Financial Local Teams over the years providing detailed instructions/guidelines and guidance in relation to specific transactions impacting our reporting KPI’s or accounting wise in our Consolidated Financial Statements, involving in many systems implementations and process assessments for improvement projects on-site in different countries around Europe, Mexico, Middle East and Asia in which I had the opportunity to meet in person our local financial teams providing my Corporate experience, expertise and knowledge of the Group, implementing better practices from other Business Units to improve their local processes, the way they work while learning their cultural local business model.
